sentences.en: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.cn: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.en: Do what you can to give her confidence and boost her morale.
sentences.cn: 尽你所能让她树立信心，提高士气。

sentences.en: He tried to bolster up their morale.
sentences.cn: 他尽力鼓舞他们的士气.

sentences.en: His death dealt a severe blow to the army's morale.
sentences.cn: 他的死严重打击了军队的士气。

sentences.en: His generous offer was a tremendous tonic for our morale.
sentences.cn: 他的慷慨相助对我们的士气是种极大的激励。

sentences.en: Many pilots are suffering from low morale.
sentences.cn: 很多飞行员目前士气低落。

sentences.en: Morale in the armed forces was at rock bottom.
Morale should be boosted , not dampened.
The crowd boosted the morale of the runners.
sentences.cn: 人们为赛跑选手们加油助威.

sentences.en: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
sentences.cn: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.en: The morale of our troops was greatly boosted.
The morale of the enemy forces sank to a very low level.
The morale of the enemy troops is continuously sagging.
The morale of the enemy troops is sinking lower every day.
the Prince’s morale-boosting (= intended to raise morale ) mission to the war﹣torn country
sentences.cn: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

sentences.en: The terrible defeat has shaken the army morale.
sentences.cn: 那次惨败动摇了这支部队的士气.

sentences.en: This win has been a great morale booster.
sentences.cn: 这次获胜是一次巨大的精神鼓舞。

sentences.en: We are all very tired and morale is low.
sentences.cn: 我们大家都非常疲惫，士气低落。

trans.tran_en: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc
